<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Seems our comment yesterday about 20 days left in the decade incited some inbox controversy. Many well-meaning folks claim the decade doesn't start for another year: Jan. 1, 2021. So let's clear the air.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>When someone says “the 2010s,” they’re almost certainly referring to the years 2010–2019, not 2011–2020. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/11/nestle-sells-us-ice-cream-unit-dairy-news?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Food Biz Tries to Avoid Dairy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ice Cream " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MTAwMjYzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just in time for eggnog season. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Nestlé <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nestle-icecream/nestle-moves-u-s-ice-cream-brands-to-froneri-in-4-billion-deal-idUSKBN1YF2AT?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed to sell</a> its U.S. ice cream business to Froneri <span>in a $4 billion deal</span> expected to close in Q1 2020 pending regulatory approval. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nestlé, the largest food company in the world, owns </span><span><span>the Dreyer’s and Drumstick brands, plus the U.S. rights to Häagen-Dazs</span></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2016, Nestlé partnered with French private equity firm PAI Partners to merge its European ice cream business with R&R, one of PAI’s divisions, to create Froneri. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This deal is scream-worthy </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Froneri did $3 billion in sales last year, and Nestlé’s U.S. ice cream unit is expected to add $1.8 billion to that top line <span>annually</span>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why Nestlé’s unloading the ice cream truck: </strong>First, its share of the U.S. ice cream market <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nestle-to-sell-u-s-ice-cream-business-to-joint-venture-11576087650?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell</a><span> to 15% last year from 19.3% in 2010</span>, per Euromonitor data cited by the WSJ. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And food tastes <a href="https://www.fooddive.com/news/nestle-sells-us-ice-cream-business-to-joint-venture-in-4b-deal/568904/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are changing</a>. Did you know what kombucha was five years ago? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2017, Nestlé announced a goal to freshen up about 10% of its portfolio. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In the years since it’s been buying healthy product brands like Sweet Earth and coffee companies like Blue Bottle and Chameleon </span><span><span>Cold-Brew</span></span><span>. Nestlé’s also revamped its water units. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Food industry rivals are up to similar tricks: </strong>Meat company Tyson Foods <a href="https://www.fooddive.com/news/tyson-to-unleash-big-food-push-into-plant-based-meats-with-new-products/556725/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ventured</a> into plant-based products and Kellogg <a href="https://www.fooddive.com/news/deal-ferrero-buys-kelloggs-cookie-brands-13b-dive-awards/565429/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unloaded</a> its cookies and fruit snacks divisions. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">In other melty news </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Perfect Day, a lab-grown <span>dairy products</span> company, <a href="https://vegnews.com/2019/12/startup-raises-140-million-to-develop-dna-identical-vegan-dairy-products?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> it closed a <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90440868/this-company-that-makes-milk-protein-without-cows-just-raised-an-utterly-huge-amount-of-cash?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$140 million</a> series C yesterday led by Singaporean government-owned Temasek. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get this: They make ice cream in labs. Perfect Day <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/16/perfect-day-foods-made-ice-cream-from-real-dairy-grown-in-lab.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uses microorganisms</a> like yeast to create dairy proteins without animals. The founders say it tastes just like cow’s milk and is “nutritionally identical.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Almond milk and beef made out of plants were only the beginning. Still, we’d like to note that Americans eat more ice cream per capita than <span>any other people in the world</span>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
POLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/11/uk-holds-general-election?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The U.K. Fancies a Change
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Parliament " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MDk0MzEwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>BrianAJackson / Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brits <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/dec/12/uk-election-how-the-voting-system-works-and-what-it-could-mean-for-brexit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will head to the polls</a> today to determine whether they’d prefer Conservative tossers or Labour wankers running the country.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The general election features races for all 650 districts that represent seats in the House of Commons. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The lucky number:</strong> <span>320. That’s how many seats each party needs to claim a majority in the Commons</span> and deliver Churchill’s fountain pen to the party’s leader.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To gain a majority, current Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s Conservative party needs to steal nine spots from Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If neither party wins a majority, you’ve got a “hung Parliament.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How we got here: </strong>Parliament can vote to hold a new election <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/11/world/europe/uk-election.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">whenever it wants</a>, <span>and this is the third time it's done so</span> since 2015. This election, the government’s trying to resolve Brexit once and for all—Johnson’s rallying cry is “Get Brexit Done,” while Corbyn would hold another referendum if he wins a majority (but that isn’t looking likely). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>polls close at 10pm <span>GMT</span>, or 5pm ET. No matter who wins, the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/whoever-wins-in-britain-big-government-spending-is-back-11576080613?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ notes</a>, expect loads of government spending. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Did you know:</strong> In the U.K., trucks are lorries, elevators are lifts, and swing districts are <em>marginal seats</em>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F12%2F11%2Fuk-holds-general-election" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/11/business-roundtable-downgrades-outlookagain?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The CEOs Watched <em>A Walk to Remember </em>Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTg1L2pwbW9yZ2FuX2Nlb19qYW1pZV9kaW1vbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>World Economic Forum, The Global Financial Context James Dimon, CC BY-SA 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Business Roundtable, a <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">squash league</span> group of CEOs of America’s biggest companies, has <a href="https://www.businessroundtable.org/media/ceo-economic-outlook-index/ceo-economic-outlook-index-q4-2019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">downgraded its outlook</a> for the U.S. economy yet again in Q4.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Keep in mind: </strong>This Roundtable survey has reported shrinking c-suite optimism for seven consecutive quarters. But over that time period, the labor market, stock market, and consumer sentiment have all been strong.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What gives?</strong> The surge in optimism among business leaders that followed President Trump’s inauguration has evaporated in a cloud of trade war uncertainty.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“There has been progress in several policy areas that has strengthened the U.S. economy from top to bottom—but </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/business-roundtable-ceo-optimism-2c53804c-3222-4bf1-ba3a-b02d781c75f3.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more progress</a></span><span> needs to be made on free and fair trade agreements,” said JPMorgan CEO and squash team captain Jamie Dimon.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nearly 39 million American jobs (</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/11/business-roundtable-cuts-outlook-again-as-ceos-see-2point1percent-growth-in-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one in five</a></span><span>) depend on international trade, added Union Pacific CEO Lance Fritz.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>While CEOs still say <a href="https://fortune.com/2019/12/11/american-ceos-to-slow-hiring-as-they-sour-on-economy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sales growth</a> is on the up, Business Roundtable’s report suggests capital investment and hiring will take a hit thanks to trade fears. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY VINCERO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
‘But I Don’t Really Wear Watches,’ You Say
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=Dec-19&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-DecB" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vincero" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1OTg2NTI5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We weren’t really watch people either—at least not since our super cool glow-in-the-dark waterproof digital watches from middle school. Let’s be honest, that’s a tough look to beat. <strong style="color:#000">Watches these days are either too trendy, too expensive, or too old-school</strong>...and we don’t like to settle. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then we tried <a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=Dec-19&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-DecB" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vincero</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Their watches are cool, classic, and bold. Each design has distinct details, intentional finishes, and quality materials meant to last—all while giving you a <strong style="color:#000">modern, fresh look</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To sum it up: <a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=Dec-19&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-DecB" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vincero</a> has high-quality watches that you can feel confident wearing...but also <em>actually</em> afford. Which is probably why they were <strong style="color:#000">featured in GQ and currently have 19,000+ 5-star reviews</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=Dec-19&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-DecB" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Browse their selection</a> and get something that beats your middle school watch game. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, you can get 15% off your new watch by using code BREW15 <a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=Dec-19&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-DecB" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/11/home-depot-blames-opioid-crisis-weak-forecast?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Home Depot’s Unusual Explanation for Slimmer Profits
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Home Depot gave a lower-than-expected sales forecast for the next fiscal year, but that was far from the most surprising thing it revealed yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The retailer said its operating profit margins would <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-11/-it-s-happening-everywhere-opioid-crisis-fuels-retail-thefts?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shrink</a> next year in large part due to more organized theft. And execs think that theft is a result of the opioid crisis. Here’s CEO Craig Menear <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/home-depot-says-opioid-crisis-may-be-contributing-to-theft?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to explain</a>: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“This is happening everywhere in retail,” he said yesterday. “We think this ties to the opioid crisis, but we’re not positive about that.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Execs said one group of thieves in Rochester, NY, was caught with $16.5 million worth of stolen goods. $1.4 million of the total haul was from Home Depot.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Retail “shrink,” which includes theft and fraud, <a href="https://nrf.com/media-center/press-releases/retail-shrink-tops-50-billion-cyber-threats-become-more-priority?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topped $50 billion</a> in 2018, per the National Retail Federation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out, courtesy of Bloomberg: </strong>“Home Depot’s admission is one of the first times a major U.S. retailer has specifically called out the opioid epidemic as a factor in its financial results.”</p>

WORKPLACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/11/maryland-commercial-real-estate-developer-gives-10-million-bonuses?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
About Your Holiday Bonus…
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Getting a huge bonus " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/XI8Lxc1ZlZjsCrfLOB/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Getting a huge bonus " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/XI8Lxc1ZlZjsCrfLOB/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>St. John Properties / Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Harry & David Grand Signature Gift Baskets will never hit the same way again. At its <a href="https://vimeo.com/378316007?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">annual holiday party</a>, a Maryland commercial real estate developer announced it’s <a href="https://apnews.com/03743db8a13e2305797eb16e36abaab0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">handing out</a> $10 million in bonuses to its 198 employees this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>The average bonus at the firm, St. John Properties, was $50,000, but some got as much as $250k. One <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/10/us/company-10-million-bonuses-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brand new</a> team member who hadn’t even started yet <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/10-million-bonus-company-bonus-maryland-012153557.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">got $100</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>St. John Properties said the bonuses celebrate hitting the milestone of developing 20 million sq. ft. of real estate. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What about developing newsletters for 1.7 million people?</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The big picture: </strong>In 2017, <a href="https://www.accountingprincipals.com/about-accounting-principals/news-room/holiday-payouts-up-bonuses-down-2017/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">63% of hiring managers</a> in the U.S. planned to give employees a monetary holiday bonus (average size: $1,797), down from 75% a year earlier, according to Accounting Principals.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Clearly, St. John Properties is coming for HubSpot, Bain, and DocuSign—which Glassdoor <a href="https://www.glassdoor.com/Award/Best-Places-to-Work-LST_KQ0%2C19.htm?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axioslogin&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just named</a> the three best places to work in 2020.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bill Gates is recommending five books for you to read this winter,</strong></span><span> and no, they’re not computer manuals. They’re great reads about everything from parenting to sleeping, and sending the link to your aunt could convince her to pass on buying you another pair of penguin pajamas. </span><span><a href="https://www.gatesnotes.com/About-Bill-Gates/Holiday-Books-2019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">See the list</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust in time for eggnog season. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Nestlé \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nestle-icecream/nestle-moves-u-s-ice-cream-brands-to-froneri-in-4-billion-deal-idUSKBN1YF2AT?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagreed to sell\u003c/a\u003e its U.S. ice cream business to Froneri \u003cspan\u003ein a $4 billion deal\u003c/span\u003e expected to close in Q1 2020 pending regulatory approval. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNestlé, the largest food company in the world, owns \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe Dreyer’s and Drumstick brands, plus the U.S. rights to Häagen-Dazs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2016, Nestlé partnered with French private equity firm PAI Partners to merge its European ice cream business with R\u0026R, one of PAI’s divisions, to create Froneri. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis deal is scream-worthy \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFroneri did $3 billion in sales last year, and Nestlé’s U.S. ice cream unit is expected to add $1.8 billion to that top line \u003cspan\u003eannually\u003c/span\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy Nestlé’s unloading the ice cream truck: \u003c/strong\u003eFirst, its share of the U.S. ice cream market \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/nestle-to-sell-u-s-ice-cream-business-to-joint-venture-11576087650?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to 15% last year from 19.3% in 2010\u003c/span\u003e, per Euromonitor data cited by the WSJ. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd food tastes \u003ca href=\"https://www.fooddive.com/news/nestle-sells-us-ice-cream-business-to-joint-venture-in-4b-deal/568904/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare changing\u003c/a\u003e. Did you know what kombucha was five years ago? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2017, Nestlé announced a goal to freshen up about 10% of its portfolio. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn the years since it’s been buying healthy product brands like Sweet Earth and coffee companies like Blue Bottle and Chameleon \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCold-Brew\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Nestlé’s also revamped its water units. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFood industry rivals are up to similar tricks: \u003c/strong\u003eMeat company Tyson Foods \u003ca href=\"https://www.fooddive.com/news/tyson-to-unleash-big-food-push-into-plant-based-meats-with-new-products/556725/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eventured\u003c/a\u003e into plant-based products and Kellogg \u003ca href=\"https://www.fooddive.com/news/deal-ferrero-buys-kelloggs-cookie-brands-13b-dive-awards/565429/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunloaded\u003c/a\u003e its cookies and fruit snacks divisions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIn other melty news \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePerfect Day, a lab-grown \u003cspan\u003edairy products\u003c/span\u003e company, \u003ca href=\"https://vegnews.com/2019/12/startup-raises-140-million-to-develop-dna-identical-vegan-dairy-products?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e it closed a \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90440868/this-company-that-makes-milk-protein-without-cows-just-raised-an-utterly-huge-amount-of-cash?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$140 million\u003c/a\u003e series C yesterday led by Singaporean government-owned Temasek. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGet this: They make ice cream in labs. Perfect Day \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/16/perfect-day-foods-made-ice-cream-from-real-dairy-grown-in-lab.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euses microorganisms\u003c/a\u003e like yeast to create dairy proteins without animals. The founders say it tastes just like cow’s milk and is “nutritionally identical.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAlmond milk and beef made out of plants were only the beginning. width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MDk0MzEwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBrianAJackson / Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBrits \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/dec/12/uk-election-how-the-voting-system-works-and-what-it-could-mean-for-brexit?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill head to the polls\u003c/a\u003e today to determine whether they’d prefer Conservative tossers or Labour wankers running the country.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe general election features races for all 650 districts that represent seats in the House of Commons. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe lucky number:\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cspan\u003e320. That’s how many seats each party needs to claim a majority in the Commons\u003c/span\u003e and deliver Churchill’s fountain pen to the party’s leader.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo gain a majority, current Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s Conservative party needs to steal nine spots from Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf neither party wins a majority, you’ve got a “hung Parliament.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow we got here: \u003c/strong\u003eParliament can vote to hold a new election \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/11/world/europe/uk-election.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhenever it wants\u003c/a\u003e, \u003cspan\u003eand this is the third time it's done so\u003c/span\u003e since 2015. This election, the government’s trying to resolve Brexit once and for all—Johnson’s rallying cry is “Get Brexit Done,” while Corbyn would hold another referendum if he wins a majority (but that isn’t looking likely). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003epolls close at 10pm \u003cspan\u003eGMT\u003c/span\u003e, or 5pm ET. No matter who wins, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/whoever-wins-in-britain-big-government-spending-is-back-11576080613?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWSJ notes\u003c/a\u003e, expect loads of government spending. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Did you know:\u003c/strong\u003e In the U.K., trucks are lorries, elevators are lifts, and swing districts are \u003cem\u003emarginal seats\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" href=\"https://www.businessroundtable.org/media/ceo-economic-outlook-index/ceo-economic-outlook-index-q4-2019?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edowngraded its outlook\u003c/a\u003e for the U.S. economy yet again in Q4.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKeep in mind: \u003c/strong\u003eThis Roundtable survey has reported shrinking c-suite optimism for seven consecutive quarters. But over that time period, the labor market, stock market, and consumer sentiment have all been strong.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat gives?\u003c/strong\u003e The surge in optimism among business leaders that followed President Trump’s inauguration has evaporated in a cloud of trade war uncertainty.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“There has been progress in several policy areas that has strengthened the U.S. economy from top to bottom—but \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/business-roundtable-ceo-optimism-2c53804c-3222-4bf1-ba3a-b02d781c75f3.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore progress\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e needs to be made on free and fair trade agreements,” said JPMorgan CEO and squash team captain Jamie Dimon.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNearly 39 million American jobs (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/11/business-roundtable-cuts-outlook-again-as-ceos-see-2point1percent-growth-in-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone in five\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e) depend on international trade, added Union Pacific CEO Lance Fritz.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile CEOs still say \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2019/12/11/american-ceos-to-slow-hiring-as-they-sour-on-economy/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esales growth\u003c/a\u003e is on the up, Business Roundtable’s report suggests capital investment and style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHome Depot gave a lower-than-expected sales forecast for the next fiscal year, but that was far from the most surprising thing it style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshrink\u003c/a\u003e next year in large part due to more organized theft. And execs think that theft is a result of the opioid crisis. Here’s CEO Craig Menear \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/home-depot-says-opioid-crisis-may-be-contributing-to-theft?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“This is happening everywhere in retail,” he said yesterday. “We think of thieves in Rochester, NY, was caught with $16.5 million worth of stolen goods. $1.4 million of the total haul was from Home Depot.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRetail “shrink,” which includes theft and fraud, \u003ca href=\"https://nrf.com/media-center/press-releases/retail-shrink-tops-50-billion-cyber-threats-become-more-priority?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped $50 billion\u003c/a\u003e in 2018, per the National Retail Federation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
